title: What is the difference between dual core and octa core? - Quora

response.answer_text: Main difference is the number of cores within the Processor, Dual Core has 2, whereas Octa core has 8. This basically means, dual core can execute two independent statements/programs, whereas an Octa core processor can execute upto 8 independent statements/programs. But just because it has more cores, doesn’t mean it will always be faster. If you are a computer science student/enthusiast you can read the link below for a more detailed account on when it will be faster and when it wont be -> Bharathram Chandrasekaran's answer to What's the difference between the Quad-core and the Octa-core processor?
